messages.subject: Re: Hi!
messages.msgSnippet: Date: Sun, 20 Jul 2003 08:27:54 -0700 From: marji  ... Great to hear from you Marji. I ve been wondering what you ve been up to. Now, I m
messages.messageBody:
Date: Sun, 20 Jul 2003 08:27:54 -0700
From: marji <marji@...>

> Hi, Folks!
>
> I miss everyone very much. I'm sorry I haven't had a lot of time to even
> read any of the posts or write or anything. I've been here but I have been
> kind of overwhelmed with my hamster-in-a-wheel-like existence (that's what
> it feels like right now, anyway). I just wanted to drop a line to let you
> know that I still exist, I still have a computer, and I'm looking forward
> to seeing everyone next month!
>
> Much love,
>
> Marji, who used to perform John Stewart's "Daydream Believer" in a duet
> with a friend of mine: "Cheer up, sleepy Gene..." {g}

Great to hear from you Marji. I've been wondering what you've been up
to. Now, I'm not going to be able to get that song out of my head. ;)

Peggy

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Hi!
messages.msgSnippet: Diane, You ve got that right. ;-) Glad to see you here Marji.  Barb E By learning to be with myself, to bring peace to myself, I can be more effective both
messages.messageBody:
Diane,
You've got that right. ;-) Glad to see you here Marji. <G>


Barb E
"By learning to be with myself, to bring peace to myself,
I can be more effective both in creating happiness in my
own life and in offering a helping hand to others."

- Ingrid Bacci, Author

messages.subject: Hi!
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, Folks! I miss everyone very much.  I m sorry I haven t had a lot of time to even read any of the posts or write or anything.  I ve been here but I have
messages.messageBody:
Hi, Folks!

I miss everyone very much. I'm sorry I haven't had a lot of time to even
read any of the posts or write or anything. I've been here but I have been
kind of overwhelmed with my hamster-in-a-wheel-like existence (that's what
it feels like right now, anyway). I just wanted to drop a line to let you
know that I still exist, I still have a computer, and I'm looking forward
to seeing everyone next month!

Much love,

Marji, who used to perform John Stewart's "Daydream Believer" in a duet
with a friend of mine: "Cheer up, sleepy Gene..." {g}
